I have a beautiful loft in Union Square Somerville with an extra bedroom and I`m looking to rent the room to a new roommate (this is not for the entire loft). The loft has 14ft ceilings, 10Ft tall windows with a beautiful view, washer and dryer in loft, located in a very cool artists community. After many years in the corporate world I have recently gone back to grad school and am now a full time student, as a result I am considering renting out my extra room. My home is vegan (vegetarian), it is a clean, quiet paradise for me, drug, smoking, and pet free. Outside of time spent on school (seems like that takes 150% of my time) I am an active member of the LGBT community in terms of event organizing, I am also an avid outdoors woman, cycling, skiing etc. My home is fully furnished except the room, bring a bed with you. Unlike most of Somerville there is extensive parking available here with a residents permit. Heat, hot water, trash pick up, on site management during business hours, plowing all included in the rent. I do not subscribe to cable TV, I choose instead to keep it simple and just have internet services in my home.
In the backyard of MIT, close to Harvard, ample bike and car parking, beautiful community outdoor space, on site art gallery and artists association. Across from Star Market, Target, Golds Gym, quick walk to Lechemere T green line, Sullivan Sq orange line, and many buses. Only 2 miles to the heart of downtown boston, a few blocks from 93. A 12-15 minute bike ride to BU Boston University Charles River campus. Borders Kendall Square, close to Museum of Science, Inman and Central Square as well.

postings.body:
I have a beautiful loft in Union Square Somerville with an extra bedroom and I`m looking to rent the room to a new roommate (this is not for the entire loft). The loft has 14ft ceilings, 10Ft tall windows with a beautiful view, washer and dryer in loft, located in a very cool artists community. After many years in the corporate world I have recently gone back to grad school and am now a full time student, as a result I am considering renting out my extra room. My home is vegan (vegetarian), it is a clean, quiet paradise for me, drug, smoking, and pet free. Outside of time spent on school (seems like that takes 150% of my time) I am an active member of the LGBT community in terms of event organizing, I am also an avid outdoor fan, cycling, skiing etc. My home is fully furnished except the room, bring a bed with you. Unlike most of Somerville there is extensive parking available here with a residents permit. Heat, hot water, trash pick up, on site management during business hours, plowing all included in the rent. I do not subscribe to cable TV, I choose instead to keep it simple and just have internet services in my home.
In the backyard of MIT, close to Harvard, ample bike and car parking, beautiful community outdoor space, on site art gallery and artists association. Across from Star Market, Target, Golds Gym, quick walk to Lechemere T green line, Sullivan Sq orange line, and many buses. Only 2 miles to the heart of downtown boston, a few blocks from 93. A 12-15 minute bike ride to BU Boston University Charles River campus. Borders Kendall Square, close to Museum of Science, Inman and Central Square as well.
Pictures are of the room for rent as well as the kitchen.

Welcome to Savoy Park, a distinctive rental community in the heart of Central Harlem. Located on Lenox Avenue within a sprawling 13 acres of green space and minutes away from several subway and bus lines, the units offer modern amenities on a site that`s rich in history.
